userreviews.userReview: A harrowing yet positive true account of overcoming intense child abuse, disaster and grief, The Choices We Make is a powerful book, and though it can be very dark at times, it never loses hope or turns for the morbid and depressing side of things.

description: A riveting story of survival-- Behrman survived not only the attack on the World Trade Center on 9/11 but also a tumultuous childhood and the suicide death of her sister. She shares her emotional toil but incredible resilience to bounce back again and again, and her journey to a life of love and happiness through forgiveness, truth, and gratitude.
title: The Choices We Make: A Memoir about Surviving and a Journey to Love & Happiness
